Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh and Australia are separated by 11 points in Group I of the 2026 FIFA World Cup Qualifiers.
Bangladesh has only one point from their four Group I games, with a 1-1 draw against Lebanon and three defeats.
Australia has won all four of their Group I games, including a 5-0 victory over Lebanon and a 7-0 reverse fixture win over Bangladesh.
The match will take place at the Bashundhara Kings Arena on June 6, 2024, at 4:15 PM IST.
Bangladesh's Shekh Morsalin is a crucial player who has scored four goals in the World Cup qualifiers, while Australia's Adam Taggart is expected to start and has scored six goals in 17 caps.
Others: Nestory Irankunda, an 18-year-old winger set to join Bayern Munich, will debut for Bangladesh.
